snippet: The president signed a strategic partnership with President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, focusing on questions of stability after the Americans depart.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Speaking from a military base near Kabul after a brief, surprise night visit to Afghanistan on the anniversary of Osama bin Laden's death, President Obama said that ''we have a clear path to fulfill our mission in Afghanistan.'' ''The goal that I set, to defeat Al Qaeda and deny it the chance to rebuild, is now within our reach,'' he said.

headline.main: In Speech, Obama Says U.S. Will Stand by Afghans After Troop Withdrawal

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: UNITED STATES DEFENSE AND MILITARY FORCES
